metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1305 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Security constraints defined by annotations of Servlets in Apache Tomcat9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.4, 8.5.0 to 8.5.27, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.49 and 7.0.0 to 7.0.84were only applied once a Servlet had been loaded. Because securityconstraints defined in this way apply to the URL pattern and any URLs belowthat point, it was possible - depending on the order Servlets were loaded -for some security constraints not to be applied. This could have exposedresources to users who were not authorised to access them.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1305` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.1-java - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1
libtomcat8-embed-java - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1
libtomcat8-java - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1
tomcat8 - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-admin - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-common - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-examples - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-user - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tomcat8 package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.5.30-1ubuntu1').
